title: Elling (play)
text:
Elling is a 2007 theatre adaptation by <a href="Simon%20Bent">Simon Bent</a> of the 2001 <a href="Elling">film of the same name</a>. It was directed by Paul Miller and produced at the <a href="Bush%20Theatre">Bush Theatre</a>, London, it then transferred to the <a href="West%20End%20theatre">West End</a> at Trafalgar Studios for a Critically acclaimed and near sold out 12 week run, with <a href="John%20Simm">John Simm</a> in the title role (who was nominated for an Olivier award for best actor) <a href="Adrian%20Bower">Adrian Bower</a>, <a href="Ingrid%20Lacey">Ingrid Lacey</a>, <a href="Jonathan%20Cecil">Jonathan Cecil</a> & <a href="Keir%20Charles">Keir Charles</a>. 
A completely different (and far less successful) version of the play premiered on <a href="Broadway%20theatre">Broadway</a> on November 21, 2010 using a completely different cast and director, it closed on November 28, 2010, after 9 performances and 22 previews. The cast starred <a href="Brendan%20Fraser">Brendan Fraser</a> and <a href="Denis%20O%27Hare">Denis O'Hare</a> playing the mismatched roommates who deal with common concerns related to friendship, work and women. It also stars <a href="Jennifer%20Coolidge">Jennifer Coolidge</a> as Reidun, <a href="Richard%20Easton">Richard Easton</a> as Alfons, and <a href="Jeremy%20Shamos">Jeremy Shamos</a> as Frank.
